  • On a 9-15: You deal your MD and the target is Burning for 1 round.
  • On a 1-8: You deal half your MD.

name: Power Word: Fortitude
description:
You speak a word of power, infusing your allies with holy vitality and resilience. This blessing lasts for a full hour outside of combat.

In a timed scene, you use 'Power Word: Fortitude'.

Power Word: Fortitude

When you bolster your allies, spend 2 MP and roll+CHA.

  • On a 16+: You and all allies within a 5-square radius gain 8 temporary HP for the duration of the combat.
  • On a 9-15: You and one chosen ally gain 8 temporary HP.
  • On a 1-8: You only gain 4 temporary HP.

name: Power Word: Shield
description:
You create a bubble of divine energy around an ally, absorbing incoming damage. The shield can be cast on an ally to protect them from environmental hazards for a short time.

In a timed scene, you use 'Power Word: Shield'.

Power Word: Shield

(Reaction) When an ally within 8 squares is hit by an attack, you can spend your reaction and 1 MP to shield them. Roll+WIS.

  • On a 16+: The shield absorbs an amount of damage equal to your MD + 8.
  • On a 9-15: The shield absorbs an amount of damage equal to your MD.
  • On a 1-8: The shield is weak and absorbs only 1d6 damage.

name: Renew
description:
You instill an ally with a gentle, healing light that mends their wounds over time. This can be used to tend to allies during a short rest, doubling the healing effect.

In a timed scene, you use 'Renew'.

Renew

When you touch an ally to heal them, spend 1 MP and roll+WIS.

  • On a 16+: The ally heals 1d6 HP instantly and another 1d6 HP at the start of their next 2 turns.
  • On a 9-15: The ally heals 1d6 HP at the start of their next 2 turns (no instant heal).
  • On a 1-8: The healing energy is weak and only heals 1d4 HP instantly.

name: Spirit of Redemption
description:
When you are about to fall, your spirit briefly separates from your body, becoming an avatar of pure healing before passing on.

This ability modifies your Last Breath.

Spirit of Redemption

Effect Type: Passive

When you make a Last Breath roll and get a 1-8 result, you do not die immediately. Instead, you become a Spirit of Redemption for 2 rounds. In this form, you are immune to all damage, cannot move, and can cast any healing spell you know without spending MP. After your second turn, you die.

name: Divine Hymn
description:
You channel a powerful hymn of holy energy, healing all nearby allies. This can also be used to bring peace to a tense crowd or sanctify a small area.

In a timed scene, you use 'Divine Hymn'.

Divine Hymn

When you spend your action and 3 MP to channel a hymn, roll+CHA.

  • On a 16+: You heal up to 3 allies you can see within 8 squares for an amount equal to your MD + 5.
  • On a 9-15: You heal up to 2 allies for an amount equal to your MD.
  • On a 1-8: Your voice falters. The hymn consumes your MP but only heals one ally for 1d6 HP.

name: Leap of Faith
description:
You pull an ally out of harm's way with a tether of holy light, instantly repositioning them to your side. This movement is a **Shift**.

Leap of Faith

When you use your action to pull an ally within 8 squares towards you, spend 1 MP and roll+WIS.

  • On a 16+: You instantly Shift the ally to an empty square adjacent to you. They gain +2 Armor for 1 round.
  • On a 9-15: You Shift the ally to an adjacent square.
  • On a 1-8: The tether is weak. The ally is only pulled 2 squares toward you, and you are knocked prone from the strain.

name: Shining Force
description:
You create a burst of holy light around an ally, knocking back and slowing nearby enemies.

Shining Force

When you target an ally within 6 squares, spend 2 MP and roll+WIS.

  • On a 16+: A burst of light erupts from your ally. All enemies within 2 squares of them are thrown back (Push 2) and are Slowed for 2 rounds.
  • On a 9-15: All adjacent enemies are pushed back (Push 1) and are Slowed for 1 round.
  • On a 1-8: Only a weak burst is created, inflicting Push 1 on adjacent enemies.

name: Divine Star
description:
You launch a star of divine energy that travels forward, damaging enemies and healing allies, before returning to you.

Divine Star

When you spend an action and 2 MP to launch the star, choose a direction. The star travels 6 squares out and 6 squares back in a straight line. Roll+WIS.

  • On a 16+: Any enemy the star passes through takes your MD. Any ally it passes through heals for your MD.
  • On a 9-15: The star deals/heals for half your MD.
  • On a 1-8: The star's energy is chaotic. It deals/heals for half your MD on the way out, but dissipates before it returns.

name: Apotheosis
description:
Through extreme devotion, you ascend to a higher state of being, temporarily embodying the full power of your faith.

In a timed scene, you use 'Apotheosis'.

Apotheosis

Once per day, when you spend your action to ascend, roll+WIS.

  • On a 16+: For 3 rounds, your healing spells heal for the maximum possible amount, and your damaging holy spells are all critical hits.
  • On a 9-15: The effect lasts for only 1 round.
  • On a 1-8: The power is too great to contain. You are Stunned for 1 round.

name: A Motley Crew of Scoundrels
description: Your friends are not the pillars of society. Your inner circle consists of a charming con artist named Silas / Lyra who can talk their way out of any trouble, a tough-as-nails smuggler named Ronan / Anya who knows all the secret routes, and a gambler named Finn who seems to have luck on their side, for now. They are loyal to a fault, but their solutions to problems are rarely legal.

name: Mentors in a Guild
description: Your closest bonds were forged within the structured environment of a professional guild. Your most trusted friend is your mentor, Master Helena / Olen / Theron, who taught you the trade. You also share a friendly but intense rivalry with another skilled guild member named Perrin / Anya / Kael, constantly pushing each other to greater heights.

name: Brothers in Arms
description: You survived a brutal war, and the only people who truly understand are the other members of your old unit. Your best friend is Garrus / Tyrus / Bronn, the grizzled sergeant who saved your life more than once. You also keep in close contact with the unit's sharp-witted scout, Elara / Finnian / Orin, who always seems to know what's over the next hill.

name: An Unlikely Friendship
description: Your best friend is someone no one would expect you to associate with. Choose one: Thokk, an ogre with a surprising love for poetry; Fizzle, a goblin merchant who once tried to swindle you but now trusts you implicitly; or Sylvana, a haughty elven noble who finds your 'rustic' ways amusing. They offer a unique perspective and surprising resources.

name: The Drinking Companions
description: Your social circle was forged in the taverns and alehouses. Your best drinking buddy is Garrus / Maeve / Bronn, a boisterous mercenary with a thousand tall tales. You are also close with the tavern's world-weary owner, Old Man Hemlock, who has seen it all, and a quiet regular named Silas who seems to know more than he lets on.

name: Academic Rivals
description: Your closest relationships were forged in the competitive environment of a magical academy. Your best friend and greatest rival is Valerius / Elara / Kael; you constantly push each other to be better. You also rely on your wise and patient mentor, Archmage Valerius / Lyra / Alistair, for guidance and perspective.

name: A Secret Society
description: You are part of a clandestine group dedicated to a hidden cause—preserving forbidden knowledge, hunting supernatural threats, or manipulating politics from the shadows. Your only true friends are your fellow members: the idealistic true believer Lyra / Theron, and the cynical but reliable veteran of the order, Kael / Seraphina.

name: The Old Adventuring Party
description: This isn't your first time on the road. You used to adventure with another group, but you parted ways after a job went wrong. You're still on good terms with the group's stoic leader, a Paladin named Zane / Anya, and their wild, unpredictable Mage, Lyra / Elminster / Fizzlebang. The reasons for the group's dissolution are complicated and best not spoken of.

name: A Web of Informants
description: Your 'friends' are a network of contacts spread throughout the city's underbelly. Your most reliable informant is a street urchin with sharp eyes known only as 'Whispers'. You also have a working relationship with a corrupt but useful guard named Sergeant Borin and a tavern keeper named Elara who hears everything.

name: A Sacred Fellowship
description: Your closest friends are fellow members of your holy order. You are deeply bonded with Joric / Lyra, a devout and compassionate Priest who serves as the group's moral compass. You also share a close, protective friendship with Theron / Anya, a stoic Paladin who embodies the martial strength of your faith.

name: Unflinching Courage
description: Where others see overwhelming odds, you see a worthy challenge. You are naturally brave, often the first to charge into danger and the last to retreat. This courage can be inspiring, but some might call it reckless.

name: Inquisitive Mind
description: You are driven by an insatiable curiosity. No ancient ruin can be left unexplored, no strange artifact unexamined, no secret left uncovered. You believe that knowledge is the key to all power, a belief that often leads you into fascinating and dangerous places.

name: Pragmatic Survivor
description: Ideals are luxuries for those who have never had to fight for their next meal. You are a pragmatist, focused on what works and what keeps you and your allies alive. You make hard choices without flinching and believe that surviving to fight another day is the only victory that matters.

name: Jovial Optimist
description: You face the world with a smile and an unshakable belief that things will turn out for the best. You are quick with a joke, eager to make new friends, and your good cheer is often infectious. Even in the darkest of times, you are the one to lift the spirits of your companions.

name: Stoic Guardian
description: You are a person of few words but immense loyalty. You express yourself through actions, not speeches, and you feel a deep, unwavering responsibility to protect those you care about. You are the shield that stands before the innocent, silent and unbreakable.

name: Cynical Schemer
description: You believe that everyone has an angle and that trusting someone is the fastest way to get a knife in your back. You are always looking for the hidden motive, the secret advantage, and the escape route. Your cynicism keeps you safe, but it also keeps you alone.

name: Devout Believer
description: Your faith is the bedrock of your existence. You see the hand of your deity in all things and strive to be a worthy instrument of their will. You are compassionate to the faithful and righteous in your judgment of heretics. Your conviction is your greatest strength.

name: Wise Counselor
description: You are thoughtful, patient, and a keen observer of the world. You prefer to listen rather than speak, offering your advice only when you are certain of its value. Others seek you out for your calm demeanor and the wisdom of your counsel, knowing you will see the path they have missed.

name: Ambitious Tycoon
description: You see the world as a ladder to be climbed. You are driven by a burning ambition to acquire wealth, influence, and power. Every situation is an opportunity, every person a potential asset or rival. You are willing to take calculated risks to achieve your goals and believe that fortune favors the bold.

name: Hot-Headed Brawler
description: Your first instinct is to solve problems with your fists. You are quick to anger, fiercely competitive, and you live for the thrill of a good fight. You might not always start the brawl, but you always intend to finish it. Subtlety is not your strong suit.

name: Gentle Giant
description: Despite your intimidating size or strength, you possess a gentle and compassionate heart. You are slow to anger and prefer peace to conflict. You have a soft spot for small creatures and the downtrodden, and your protective instincts are formidable when those you care for are threatened.

name: Eccentric Genius
description: Your mind operates on a different level from everyone else's. You see patterns and solutions that others miss, but you often have trouble explaining your brilliant ideas in a way that makes sense. You are easily distracted by new puzzles and can seem absent-minded or strange to others.

name: Human
description:
Humans are known for their exceptional versatility and tenacity. Lacking overt natural strengths, their true power lies in their boundless potential and unwavering spirit.

Adaptability

(Passive)

You are a quick learner. You require 1 less XP to purchase your first three Feature cards.

Human Spirit

(Passive)

Your innate resilience is surprising. You gain a +2 bonus on all rolls to resist the Frightened and Charmed conditions.

name: Dwarf
description:
Born of the earth, Dwarves are a stout and incredibly resilient people with a natural hardiness that shrugs off toxins and hardship.

Dwarven Resilience

(Passive)

Your body is naturally resistant to toxins. You have advantage on all rolls to resist poison or disease, and you take half damage from all poison sources.

Unyielding

(Passive)

You are as rooted as a mountain. You cannot be unwillingly moved by the Push or Pull effects from creatures your size or smaller.

name: Night Elf
description:
Kaldorei are graceful, nocturnal beings with a natural affinity for the shadows and the wilds. Their movements are fluid and their senses uncannily sharp.

Quickness

(Passive)

Your natural agility makes you harder to hit. You have a +1 bonus to your base SPEED.

Shadowmeld

When you use your action to stand perfectly still in dim light or darkness, you blend into the shadows. You are considered Invisible until you move or take another action.

name: Gnome
description:
Gnomes are a small, clever race with a hyperactive intellect and nimble fingers, perfectly suited for manipulating intricate devices or slipping from a giant's grasp.

Expansive Mind

(Passive)

Your mind processes information at an incredible rate. You have advantage on all INT rolls to solve puzzles or recall information.

Escape Artist

(Reaction) When you would be affected by the Immobilized or Slowed condition, you can use your reaction to roll+DEX.

  • On a 16+: You completely avoid the effect.
  • On a 9-15: The effect's duration is reduced to 1 round.
  • On a 1-8: The effect applies as normal, but you may attempt to escape again on your next turn as a free action.

name: Orc
description:
Orcs are a physically powerful and ferocious people. Their bodies are built for battle, and a lifetime of hardship has made them incredibly tough.

Hardiness

(Passive)

Your natural resilience is legendary. The duration of any Stunned condition affecting you is reduced by 1 round (to a minimum of 1).

Blood Fury

When you tap into your inner rage, spend 1 SP and roll+CON.

  • On a 16+: For 2 rounds, all your HD attacks deal +5 damage.
  • On a 9-15: For 1 round, your HD attacks deal +5 damage.
  • On a 1-8: The fury is taxing. For 1 round, your HD attacks deal +5 damage, but you are Weakened.

name: Forsaken Undead
description:
As one of the undead, your body is no longer constrained by the needs of the living. You are a tireless, unfeeling being, driven by sheer willpower.

Undead Nature

(Passive)

You do not need to breathe, eat, or sleep. You are immune to all diseases and poisons.

Touch of the Grave

(Passive)

Your melee attacks have a chance to drain life. When you successfully deal HD, you heal for an amount equal to your COS modifier (minimum 1).

name: Tauren
description:
You are a Shu'halo, a hulking bovine humanoid of immense size and strength. Your connection to the earth makes you a steadfast and formidable presence.

Brawn

(Passive)

Your massive frame is difficult to damage. You have a permanent +1 bonus to your Armor.

War Stomp

When you use your action to stomp the ground with terrific force, roll+STR.

  • On a 16+: All adjacent enemies take 1d4 damage. If an enemy's COS is less than your STR, they are also Stunned for 1 round.
  • On a 9-15: All adjacent enemies are Stunned for 1 round, but you deal no damage.
  • On a 1-8: You lose your footing and are knocked prone.

name: Troll
description:
Trolls are lanky, resilient hunters with a unique physiology that allows them to recover from grievous wounds at an astonishing rate.

Regeneration

(Passive)

Your body constantly mends itself. At the start of your turn, if you have taken damage, you automatically heal for an amount equal to your CON modifier (minimum 1). This does not function if you are at 0 HP.

Berserking

When you embrace your primal fury, spend 1 SP and roll+CON.

  • On a 16+: For 2 rounds, you may make an additional attack as a free action on your turn, but it has disadvantage.
  • On a 9-15: The effect lasts for only 1 round.
  • On a 1-8: The rage consumes you. You are Confused for 1 round.

name: Goblin
description:
Goblins are small, crafty, and possess a fast-talking, opportunistic nature. Their true biological advantage is a mind that calculates odds and angles better than any other.

Best Deals Anywhere

(Passive)

Your mind is always calculating the odds. You have advantage on all rolls made to haggle, appraise an item's value, or detect a bad deal.

Time is Money

(Passive)

You have a natural haste. You gain a +1 bonus to all Initiative rolls.

name: Draenei
description:
Draenei are a long-lived and physically imposing race, their bodies infused with the very essence of the Holy Light, granting them innate restorative powers.

Shadow Resistance

(Passive)

Your body is infused with Light. You take half damage from all sources of necrotic or shadow-based magical damage.

Gift of the Naaru

When you spend an action to channel the Light to heal a creature you can touch, roll+WIS.

  • On a 16+: The target is healed for an amount equal to your MD + 5.
  • On a 9-15: The target is healed for an amount equal to your MD.
  • On a 1-8: The Light is weak; the target heals only 1d4 HP.

name: Worgen
description:
Afflicted by a primal curse, your body can shift between a civilized human form and a feral, wolf-like beast, granting you savage strength and speed.

Two Forms

As an action, you can transform between your Human and Worgen forms. While in Worgen form, your base HD becomes 1d8, and your SPEED increases by 1.

Viciousness

(Passive)

Your critical hits are especially brutal. When you roll a 20+ on a HD attack, you deal an additional 1d6 damage.

name: Blood Elf
description:
The Sin'dorei are a race deeply attuned to the arcane. Their bodies have adapted to the constant presence of magic, allowing them to resist and manipulate it with an ease others envy.

Arcane Acuity

(Passive)

You are a natural conduit for magic. You have an additional +5 MP.

Magic Resistance

(Passive)

Your attunement to the arcane allows you to shrug off lesser magical effects. You have advantage on all rolls to resist harmful spells or magical conditions.

name: Pandaren
description:
Pandaren possess a surprising resilience, their dense bodies and fur allowing them to shrug off impacts that would cripple other races.

Bouncy

(Passive)

You are naturally padded and resilient. You take half damage from falling.

Quaking Palm

When you use your action to strike an enemy's pressure points, roll+DEX.

  • On a 16+: You deal no damage, but the target is completely incapacitated. If their CON is less than your DEX, they are Stunned for 2 rounds. Otherwise, they are Stunned for 1 round. This effect breaks if they take any damage.
  • On a 9-15: The target is Weakened for 2 rounds.
  • On a 1-8: You miss the pressure point, and the target can use their Reaction to make a free attack against you.

name: Urban Pacification & Crowd Control
description: A certification from the City Watch academy, this course focused on de-escalation and non-lethal subjugation. You learned shield-wall tactics for riot control, specific joint-locks to disarm brawlers, and the precise amount of force needed to end a fight without starting a vendetta.

name: Exotic Beast Handling for the Arena
description: You completed a brutal course offered by a pit-fighting syndicate on how to manage their gladiatorial beasts. You learned the specific dietary needs of a basilisk, the proper way to approach a territorial hippogriff, and the signs of sickness in a captive manticore. It was a hands-on education where failure often meant being the main course.

name: Royal Protocol & Threat Assessment
description: A mandatory course for all members of the Royal Guard. This training drilled into you the complex rules of courtly etiquette, the subtle art of identifying assassins by their posture, and the protocols for evacuating a monarch from a compromised location. You spent months in simulated scenarios, from banquet poisonings to full-scale sieges.

name: Anatomy of an Assassination
description: This clandestine course, offered only to ranking members of a shadow guild, covered the theoretical and practical aspects of high-profile elimination. You studied architectural weak points for infiltration, the toxicology of slow-acting poisons, and the social engineering required to get close to a well-guarded target.

name: Introduction to Thaumaturgical Linguistics
description: A university course focused on the languages of magic. You learned to translate the high draconic runes used in ancient fire spells, to decipher the cryptic glyphs of abjuration wards, and to understand the grammatical structure of infernal contracts. The course emphasized that in magic, precise wording is the difference between power and a catastrophic explosion.

name: Advanced Social Maneuvering
description: You attended an exclusive finishing school for the politically ambitious. The curriculum included 'The Art of the Veiled Threat,' 'The Economics of Marriage Alliances,' and 'Practical Application of Flattery.' You learned that a well-placed rumor could cripple a merchant house faster than any army, and that true power is never held, only wielded.

name: Survival: Tracking in Hostile Environments
description: A field course taught by a master ranger. You spent a season in the blighted lands, learning to track a manticore across barren rock, to identify the subtle signs of a territorial wyvern, and how to differentiate between the lairs of goblins and kobolds from a distance. The final exam was to survive a week with only a knife and the knowledge you'd gained.

name: Theological Studies & Rites
description: You completed a formal education at a major seminary. This course covered the complete histories of the major deities, the proper execution of high holy rites, and the philosophical differences between various religious sects. You can recite scripture by heart and can identify the patron saint of any given trade or predicament.

name: Practical Alchemy: Transmutation & Tinctures
description: This intensive workshop focused on the practical application of alchemy. You learned the fundamental principles of transmutation (turning lead to less-valuable lead), the correct way to distill elemental essences, and how to brew a dozen different common potions, from healing draughts to elixirs of strength. You have the singed eyebrows to prove it.

name: Introduction to Siege Weaponry
description: A course offered by the military for its engineer corps. You learned the physics of a catapult's throwing arm, the chemistry of incendiary projectiles, and the structural mechanics of a battering ram. You can look at a castle wall and immediately identify the best place to apply overwhelming force.

name: Counter-Intelligence & Ciphering
description: You were trained in the delicate art of information warfare. This course covered the creation and breaking of common ciphers, the planting of false information to mislead rival factions, and the methods for identifying and turning double agents. You learned that the most valuable secrets are the ones your enemy thinks they stole from you.

name: Metaphysics of the Outer Planes
description: An advanced course for only the most promising magi. Your studies focused not on practical spellcasting, but on the nature of reality itself. You explored the architecture of the elemental planes, debated the philosophical paradoxes of time travel, and studied the theoretical energies that bind the cosmos together. You have a profound, and perhaps unsettling, understanding of the universe.

name: A Debt Owed
description:
You owe a significant debt to a dangerous organization. They let you live, but one day they will come to collect, and the price will be far greater than coin.

Whenever you are in a civilized settlement, the GM may use a move to have your debtors appear and make a demand. Refusing them will have serious, immediate consequences. You start with no money.

name: Haunted by the Past
description:
You made a terrible mistake—a failure that led to someone's death or a great catastrophe. The guilt follows you, appearing in your nightmares and causing you to hesitate when lives are on the line.

When you attempt to Defy Danger to save someone from immediate harm, you have disadvantage on your roll as your past failures flash before your eyes.

name: Arrogant and Proud
description:
You are exceptionally skilled, and you know it. You rarely back down from a challenge to your honor and find it difficult to admit when you are wrong.

When an ally attempts to use the Aid move on you, they have disadvantage on their roll because you instinctively resist their 'help'. You cannot refuse a direct challenge to a one-on-one duel.

name: Addiction
description:
You have a vice you cannot control—a dependency on a rare substance or a gambling problem. This addiction clouds your judgment and constantly drains your resources.

When you Take a Rest, you do not recover any SP unless you have first indulged in your addiction. If you go more than one session without indulging, you have disadvantage on all WIS and INT rolls until you do.

name: A Vow of Poverty
description:
You have sworn an oath to forsake material wealth, keeping only what you need to survive. This makes you noble, but perpetually short on coin for bribes, supplies, and other necessities.

You may never have more than 20 gold on your person at any time. When you acquire more, you must give the excess away to a worthy cause as soon as possible. You cannot benefit from the 'Purchase Treasure Booster' downtime activity.

name: Hunted
description:
You have a relentless pursuer on your trail—a determined bounty hunter, an implacable lawman, or a vengeful survivor. You can never stay in one place for long, as they are always just a few steps behind.

When you take the 'Time Off' downtime activity in the same location more than once in a row, your pursuer automatically finds you and ambushes the party.

name: Paranoid
description:
You see betrayal and conspiracy in every shadow. You find it incredibly difficult to trust new people and you second-guess your allies' motives.

You can never be the beneficiary of the Aid move from your allies. Additionally, when an ally gets a Low Hit (1-8) on a roll while near you, the GM may tell you that you perceive their failure as a deliberate act of betrayal.

name: Amnesia
description:
Your identity is a blank slate. Flashes of a forgotten life—and forgotten enemies or obligations—sometimes surface at the worst possible moments.

At the start of each session, the GM may give you a secret, one-word instruction based on your past (e.g., 'Flee', 'Betray', 'Protect'). If you do not act on this instruction, you take 1d6 SD at the end of the session from psychic strain.

name: Naive and Sheltered
description:
You grew up in such a protected environment that you have no understanding of the cynicism and cruelty of the world. You are easily tricked and take promises at face value.

You have disadvantage on all rolls to Discern Realities or Spout Lore when dealing with social situations involving deceit, crime, or betrayal. You cannot lie to friendly NPCs.

name: Cursed
description:
You are afflicted by a magical curse that manifests as a physical malady or social stigma, causing constant pain and complication in your life.

At the start of each session, roll a d6. On a 1-2, your curse flares up. You start the session with a random condition (Weakened, Slowed, or Poisoned for 1d4 MD) that cannot be removed by normal means.

name: Code of Honor
description:
You live by a strict personal code that you will not break. You will not strike an unarmed foe, lie, or abandon the innocent, even when it would be tactically wise to do so.

When you take an action that directly violates your code (GM's discretion), you immediately take SD equal to your level and are Weakened for your next roll as your spirit recoils in shame.

name: Loudmouth
description:
You have no filter. You are prone to boasting, revealing secrets at inopportune times, and insulting powerful people without thinking.

When you attempt to parley or negotiate using tact or subtlety, you have disadvantage on your roll. The GM can force you to reveal one piece of sensitive information on any Low Hit (1-8) roll.

name: Greedy
description:
You are driven by an insatiable lust for gold and treasure, often taking foolish risks for the promise of a greater reward.

When presented with a clear opportunity to gain wealth, you must Defy Danger (WIS) to resist acting on it immediately, even if it is a blatant trap or puts your allies in danger.

name: Phobia
description:
You have an irrational and overwhelming fear of a specific thing (e.g., spiders, enclosed spaces, heights). When confronted with it, your composure shatters.

When you are in the presence of the object of your phobia, you must Defy Danger (WIS). On a 1-8, you are Frightened for as long as it is present. On a 9-15, you are Weakened for your next roll.

name: Reckless Abandon
description:
Caution is a word for cowards. You are always the first into the fray, often without a plan, believing that overwhelming force is the only strategy needed.

On your first turn in any timed scene, you must use your movement to get as close as possible to the nearest enemy. You cannot use the Defend or Disengage actions.

name: Magical Allergy
description:
Your body has an adverse reaction to beneficial magic. While others are mended by healing spells, you feel a painful, itching sensation that resists the energy.

Whenever you are the target of a spell that restores HP, you only receive half of the healing (rounded down).

name: Unstable Patronage
description:
Your power comes from a fickle, demanding entity. It grants you strength, but its whims are unpredictable and its price is often inconveniently steep.

At the start of each session, the GM gives you a command from your patron. If you have not made significant progress on it by the session's end, you start the next session with all of your MP and SP halved.

name: Pacifist's Burden
description:
You have taken a vow to never take a sentient life. While you can fight to subdue, the act of killing weighs heavily upon your soul, causing you to recoil in moments of accidental violence.

You cannot willingly strike a killing blow against a humanoid creature. If you accidentally defeat one (reducing them to 0 HP), you are overcome with remorse and are Stunned for 1 round.

name: Clumsy
description:
You are not the most graceful individual. Your movements are often awkward, and in the heat of the moment, you're prone to stumbling, dropping things, or making a general mess of the situation.

When you roll a Low Hit (1-8) on any roll involving DEX, the GM can introduce a severe complication, such as dropping your weapon, falling prone, or hitting an ally by mistake.

name: Notorious
description:
Your name and face are well-known, but for all the wrong reasons. Whether you're a famed charlatan, a disgraced knight, or a suspected traitor, your reputation precedes you and rarely helps.

You have disadvantage on all initial CAR rolls when interacting with strangers in a civilized setting who might have heard of you. Guards and officials are automatically suspicious of you.

name: Glass Cannon
description:
You have focused all of your training on overwhelming offense, leaving your defenses dangerously neglected. You can dish it out, but you really can't take it.

You deal +1 damage with all attacks (HD, MD, and SD). However, your maximum HP is permanently reduced by 4.

name: Mute
description:
Whether from a physical injury, a magical curse, or a psychological trauma, you cannot speak. You must rely on gestures, writing, or other means to communicate.

You automatically fail any roll that requires speaking. To cast spells with verbal components, you must first succeed on a DEX roll (9+) to perform the correct somatic gestures.

name: Curious to a Fault
description:
You are possessed by a burning need to understand the unknown. No glowing rune can be left untouched, no strange lever unpulled, and no ancient tome unread, regardless of the obvious danger.

When presented with a clearly magical and mysterious object or puzzle, you must Defy Danger (WIS) to resist interacting with it immediately in the most direct way possible.

name: Frail Body
description:
You have a weak constitution, making you susceptible to sickness and exhaustion. Mortal wounds seem to cling to you more than others.

You have disadvantage on all rolls to resist disease or poison. Additionally, you have disadvantage on your Last Breath roll when you are reduced to 0 HP.

name: Soulbound Item
description:
A part of your soul is tied to a specific item—a weapon, an amulet, a book. Your power is linked to it, and you feel a deep, gnawing emptiness when you are separated from it.

You are bound to one of your starting items. If you are ever more than 10 squares away from it for more than a minute, you are permanently Weakened until you are reunited with it.

name: Protective of the Weak
description:
You have a soft spot for the underdog and cannot stand by while an innocent is bullied or harmed. You feel a deep compulsion to intervene, even when it's unwise.

When you see an unarmed or clearly outmatched innocent in immediate physical danger, you must Defy Danger (WIS) to not intervene and protect them in the most direct way possible.

name: Marked by the Fey
description:
You once stumbled into a fey crossing or made a deal with a fey creature, and now you bear their mark. The world of the fey is aware of you, and they see you as a plaything.

You have disadvantage on all social rolls against Fey creatures (they find you amusingly predictable). On any Low Hit (1-8), the GM can introduce a complication involving mischievous or malevolent fey spirits.

name: Poor Eyesight
description:
Whether you're near-sighted or far-sighted, the world is a blur to you without your corrective lenses. Your effectiveness at a distance is severely hampered.

You have disadvantage on all Volley attacks targeting an enemy more than 8 squares away. You also have disadvantage on all rolls to Discern Realities for things you are trying to see at a distance.

name: Forgetful
description:
Your memory is a sieve. You have trouble remembering names, faces, and important details, which can lead to awkward and dangerous social situations.

You have disadvantage on all Spout Lore rolls that involve history, people, or events you are not currently witnessing. When you meet an important NPC, the GM may ask you to make a note of their name; you cannot write it down.

name: Technophobe
description:
You have a deep-seated distrust of complex machinery, clockwork, and especially alchemical explosives. You prefer the reliability of muscle, steel, or pure magic.

You have disadvantage on all rolls made to understand, repair, or use any item or feature that has the Gold (Ingenuity) crystal type.

name: Duelist's Pride
description:
Once you engage an opponent, your honor demands you see the fight through. To you, switching targets is a sign of weakness and cowardice.

When you deal damage to an enemy in a timed scene, you become fixated. You have disadvantage on all attacks against other targets until your current one is defeated or you are forcefully separated.

name: Expensive Tastes
description:
You are accustomed to the finer things in life—silks, fine wines, and soft beds. Roughing it is not just uncomfortable; it's an affront to your spirit.

Your cost of living for the 'Work' downtime activity is doubled. You cannot benefit from the 'Recover' downtime activity unless you also spend at least 50 gold on luxuries and fine living.

name: Outcast
description:
For a crime you may or may not have committed, you have been exiled from your homeland. Your name is mud, your family has disowned you, and returning would mean imprisonment or death.

You cannot willingly enter your home settlement or region. If you are forced to, all social rolls you make with your former people are made with disadvantage, and you will be reported to the authorities if recognized.

name: Missing Eye
description:
You are missing an eye, covered by a patch or a gruesome scar. This has left you with poor depth perception and a significant blind spot.

You have disadvantage on all Volley attacks and on any rolls made to Discern Realities that rely on sight. Enemies attacking you from your blind side gain advantage on their first attack.

name: Chronic Pain
description:
An old wound never truly healed. It aches constantly, and strenuous activity can cause the pain to flare up, hindering your actions.

When you take damage from any source, you must make a COS roll. On a failure (1-8), the flare-up is severe and you become Weakened for your next roll.

name: Limp
description:
A severe leg injury has left you with a permanent, noticeable limp. You can't move as fast as others and complex acrobatic feats are beyond you.

Your base SPEED is permanently reduced by 2 (to a minimum of 2). You have disadvantage on all DEX rolls made to jump, climb, or maintain balance.

name: Missing Arm
description:
You have lost an arm to battle or misfortune. While you have adapted, you cannot wield two-handed weapons or shields, and some tasks are much more difficult.

You cannot use any item that requires two hands (like Greatswords or Longbows). You have disadvantage on all STR rolls that would reasonably require two hands, like climbing or grappling.

name: Sickly Constitution
description:
You have always been frail and susceptible to illness. The rigors of adventuring life—poor food, bad weather, exposure to plagues—take a greater toll on you.

You have disadvantage on all rolls to resist disease, poison, or the effects of environmental hazards (extreme cold, heat, etc.). Your maximum HP is permanently reduced by 2.

name: Sun Sickness
description:
Your body is ill-suited to the harsh light of day. You are at your best in the gloom of a dungeon or the twilight hours, but the full sun saps your strength.

While in direct, bright sunlight, you are permanently Weakened. This condition is suppressed while you are in dim light, darkness, or heavy shadow.

name: Hard of Hearing
description:
A lifetime of proximity to explosions, loud war cries, or simply old age has damaged your hearing. You often miss quiet sounds and whispers.

You have disadvantage on all rolls to Discern Realities that rely on hearing. You cannot be the first to act in an ambush unless the threat is visible.

name: Brittle Bones
description:
Your bones are unusually fragile. While you are as capable as any other, a powerful blow or a long fall is much more likely to leave you broken.

You take double damage from all sources of falling damage. When you take critical damage from a physical attack, you become Slowed for the rest of the combat as a bone is fractured.

name: Slow Reflexes
description:
You are not the quickest to react to sudden danger. Your mind might see the threat, but your body is often a moment too slow to respond.

You have a permanent -2 penalty to all Initiative rolls. You cannot take a Reaction during the first round of any timed scene.

name: Noticeably Large
description:
You are unusually tall and broad for your people, making you an easy target and ill-suited for sneaking. The world is simply not built to your scale.

You can never have advantage on rolls to be stealthy. Enemies gain +1 on all Volley attacks made against you, as you are a larger target.

name: Asthma
description:
Your lungs are weak, and you are prone to fits of wheezing and shortness of breath after strenuous exertion.

After any combat encounter in which you used two or more Move actions, you must Defy Danger (CON). On a 1-8, you are Weakened until you have a chance to rest and catch your breath.

name: Tremors
description:
Your hands are afflicted with a persistent, uncontrollable tremor. While you can manage most tasks, delicate work requiring a steady hand is nearly impossible.

You have disadvantage on all rolls that require fine manual dexterity, such as disarming traps, picking locks, or performing surgery.

name: Albino
description:
You lack all pigment in your skin and hair, and your eyes are a pale, light-sensitive pink. Your appearance is striking, but the sun is your enemy.

When you are in direct, bright sunlight without protection for your eyes, you are considered Blinded.

name: Unnatural Voice
description:
An injury or a magical affliction has left your voice raspy, unnaturally deep, or unsettlingly hollow. Your attempts at friendly conversation often put people on edge.

You have disadvantage on all CAR rolls made to charm, persuade, or otherwise interact socially with strangers in a friendly manner.

name: Hemophilia
description:
Your blood does not clot properly. Even minor cuts can become dangerous, and grievous wounds are almost certainly a death sentence.

When you are afflicted with the Bleeding condition, it lasts for 1 additional round and you have disadvantage on any roll to stop it.

name: Obese
description:
You carry a great deal of excess weight. This makes you surprisingly durable but also slow and easily winded.

Your maximum HP is increased by 2. However, your base SPEED is permanently reduced by 2 (to a minimum of 2), and you cannot wear heavy armor.

name: Nerve Damage
description:
A past injury has left parts of your body numb and unresponsive. You sometimes fail to notice injuries or environmental effects.

You have disadvantage on all rolls to Discern Realities that rely on the sense of touch. You are immune to the pain from the Burning condition, but you still take its damage.

name: One-Lung
description:
You survived a grievous chest wound but lost a lung in the process. You cannot hold your breath for long and are easily winded by extended exertion.

You have disadvantage on all rolls made to hold your breath or perform strenuous activity (like running) for more than a minute. Your base Load is permanently reduced by 2.

name: Distinctive Scar
description:
You have a large, memorable scar on your face or another easily visible part of your body. It makes you easy to identify and remember, for better or worse.

You have disadvantage on all rolls made to disguise yourself or remain anonymous in a crowd. If you commit a crime, witnesses are more likely to remember you specifically.

name: Sleepwalker
description:
You are prone to sleepwalking, especially during times of stress. You have no control over your actions while asleep and often wake up in strange or dangerous places.

When you Take a Rest in a place that is not perfectly safe and comfortable, the GM can make a move. You might wander off, reveal a secret in your sleep, or wake up in a precarious situation, separated from your gear or the party.
